column5: I decided it was time to dig out the boat and go fishing on Saturday so off Earl and I went. Once we got to the water it was blowing 25 mph and just overcast. We fished for 3 hours with no bites and called it a day.The good news is I brought home 24 minnows to use Sunday at a local farm pond.It actually is a little big to be called a pond and since it shows up on google Earth I will call it a lake.  looking to the left  Looking to the right  I was into fish 2 minutes after the first cast and this beautiful Crappie comes to the dock. Their was many more to come from that hole and after 12 more the same size I moved on to see if their were bigger ones.  This was one of the bigger ones and to keep from slimming my phone I decided to take photos to as needed. I hooked on the biggest minnow in the bucket 3 inches and lobbed him out to see if he would get some action. As soon as he hit the water the bobber went down and I figured he was just to big for it but after 30 seconds I gave it a pull and reeled in this bass.   Well a few hours of catching fish and 24 minnows gone it was time to head back home.  Art
Good stuff Bud. I won't be on the liquid type h2o 'til the very last of April. Glad you had a good time.
Nice work Art !! One of the perks to southern living  Paul
Great stuff Art, nice to be out there on open water I bet, can't wait myself
Look at dat.. a fish report from Art !! Glad to see you out and about my friend!
so that's what it's like to fish soft water  can't wait to do the same
Ah, how I miss the southern 'ponds'. Not to mention the belles.
Now Art, That sounds like a darn fine way to spend the day! Glad you got out for some fun.
